name: Epigea repens
Relationship: Compare: UVA, CHIMAPH.; LYC. PAREIRA. Epigea contains Arbutin, also Formic acid.
details: Chronic cystitis, with DYSURIA; tenesmus after micturition; MUCOPUS AND URIC-ACID DEPOSIT, gravel, renal calculi. Fine sand in urine of a BROWN COLOR. Burning in neck of bladder while urinating and tenesmus afterward. Pyelitis, incontinence of urine. Croaking noise and rumbling in bowels.
dosage: Tincture in 5-drop doses every three hours.
